metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7757 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the sas_smp_get_phy_events function in drivers/scsi/libsas/sas_expander.c in the Linux kernel through 4.15.7 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via many read accesses to files in the /sys/class/sas_phy directory, as demonstrated by the /sys/class/sas_phy/phy-1:0:12/invalid_dword_count file. It was discovered that a memory leak existed in the SAS driver subsystem of the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7757` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-153-generic - 3.13.0-153.203
